title: Working with fonts
text: Although theme_360 gets us long way 360-styled plot, fonts aren’t added automatically elements. example, see plot, add annotation:  elements styled correctly, annotation. Several elements require us manually specify font: One-text annotations using ggplot2::annotate_360 variants Labels data using ggplot2::geom_text ggplot2::geom_label Additional theme customisations beyond theme_360, using ggplot2::theme
code: p3 <-   p1 +   annotate("text",     label = "Here's an additional comment.",     x = 5, y = 2500,     hjust = "inward", vjust = "inward") +   theme_360()  test_path <- knitr::fig_path(".png") save_360plot(p3, test_path, shape = "square", retina = 2) knitr::include_graphics(test_path)

title: Create graphics with ggplot2 that align with 360info style guides
text: create plots style: Add themes360info::theme_360 ggplot2 plot; Add fonts elements, like annotations additional theme customisations (see “Working fonts” article); Get brand colours using themes360info::colours_360; Add text annotations plots themes360info::annotate_360 helpers; Save plot, adding footer 360 logo, using themes360info::save_360plot
code:
library(ggplot2) library(themes360info) myplot <- ggplot(mtcars) + aes(mpg, disp) + geom_point() + annotate_360_lightblue(x = 25, y = 350, label = "**THIS IS A**
really interesting point") + theme_360() + labs( title = "BIG STATEMENT", subtitle = "But also some detail with a **key phrase** bolded", caption = "**CHART:** James Goldie, 360info") save_360plot(myplot, "man/figures/README-demo.png") knitr::include_graphics("man/figures/README-demo.png")
